description: The 35-year-old also presented Kate Winslet her award alongside 21 Jump Street co-star Jonah Hill.
title: Channing Tatum's slicked over hair at Golden Globes 2016 compared to Justin Bieber
title_page: Channing Tatum's slicked over hair at Golden Globes 2016 compared to Justin Bieber | Daily Mail Online
text:
His good looks and chiselled features have made him a fan favourite celebrity.
But on the night of the Golden Globes, it was Channing Tatum's unusual new hairdo that captured the interest of users all across the Internet.
The tweets came poring in as the 35-year-old debuted his slicked-over hairdo on Sunday, with multiple users comparing him to Justin Bieber, an emo emoji, and even a member of rock group Green Day.
Scroll down for video
The mane attraction! Channing-Tatum debuted a new slicked-over hairdo as he walked the red carpet with his wife Jenna Dewan Tatum at the Golden Globes on Sunday in Beverly Hills
The inspiration? Journalist Alexandria Symonds declared on Twitter, 'channing tatum looks exactly like the emo skype emoji'
Twitter user Carina Zhao tweeted during the awards show, 'Channing Tatum's hair is extremely questionable he looks like a member of green day.'
Journalist Alexandria Symonds declared, 'channing tatum looks exactly like the emo skype emoji.'
New York Magazine editor Kyle Buchanan wondered on Twitter, 'Did...Bieber style Channing Tatum for this?'
See the latest Justin Bieber updates as Channing Tatum seems to channel his style
Decisions, decisions: MTV Instagrammed a meme of Justin Bieber and Tatum, asking fans to 'Discuss' Channing's new look
Big questions: Kyle Buchanan wondered if Tatum recruited the pop star as his stylist for the night
My oh my: Cinya Burton was truly perplexed with Tatum's Golden Globes look
And Cinya Burton tweeted, 'GOOD HEAVENS! What in the name of Bieber is happening with Channing Tatum's hair???!?!'
Buzzfeed correspondent Kate Aurthur comically wrote, 'I'm sure there's an official explanation for Channing Tatum's hair. Can someone send me the file? #GoldenGlobes.'
The hairdo quickly drew the interest of multiple media outlets, who all contributed their own comparisons to the intriguing style.
He has some explaining to do! Kate Aurthur joked 'I'm sure there's an official explanation for Channing Tatum's hair'
It happens: Ashley Weatherford teased the 21 Jump Street star's hairdo 'is a case of when bad side parts happen to good people'
MTV captioned an Instagram meme of Justin and Channing's face, 'Discuss.'
Elsewhere, Entertainment Weekly compared Channing to Thin Man from Charlie's Angels.
Twitter user Hayley Spencer referenced Beauty And The Beast as she asked, 'Did he take a picture of Gaston to his hairstylist?'
That night, Channing and his 21 Jump Street co-star Jonah Hill presented Kate Winslet with her gong for Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in any Motion Picture at the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles in front of Hollywood's biggest stars.
Spitting image? Entertainment Weekly compared the heartthrob to Thin Man from Charlie's Angels
Inspiration? Hayley Spencer joked that the 35-year-old presented a photo of Beauty And The Beast character Gaston to his hairstylist
Going strong: Tatum has been married to his lovely wife Jenna since 2009
2016 GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS WINNERS - FILM Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture Drama Cate Blanchett, Carol Brie Larson, Room Rooney Mara, Carol Saoirse Ronan, Brooklyn Alicia Vikander, The Danish Girl Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture Drama Bryan Cranston, Trumbo Leonardo DiCaprio, The Revenant Michael Fassbender, Steve Jobs Eddie Redmayne, The Danish Girl Will Smith, Concussion Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture Musical or Comedy Christian Bale, The Big Short Steve Carell, The Big Short Matt Damon, The Martian Al Pacino, Danny Collins Mark Ruffalo - Infinitely Polar Bear
Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture Musical or Comedy Jennifer Lawrence, Joy Melissa McCarthy, Spy Amy Schumer, Trainwreck Maggie Smith, The Lady in the Van Lily Tomlin, Grandma Best Screenplay Motion Picture Josh Singer Charles Randolf The Big Short Steve Jobs Quentin Tarantino, The Hateful Eight Best Original Song Motion Picture Love Me Like You Do, Fifty Shades Of Grey One Kind Of Love, Love and Mercy See You Again, Furious 7 Simple Song #3, Youth Writing's On The Wall, Spectre
Best Motion Picture - Drama Carol Mad Max: Fury Road The Revenant Room Spotlight Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy The Big Short Joy The Martian Spy Trainwreck
Best Motion Picture - Animated Anomalisa The Good Dinosaur Inside Out The Peanuts Movie Shawn The Sheep Movie

Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in any Motion Picture Paul Dano, Love & Mercy Idris Elba, Beasts of No Nation Mark Rylance, Bridge of Spies Michael Shannon, 99 Homes Sylvester Stallone, Creed Best Director Motion Picture Todd Haynes, Carol Alejandro G Inarritu, The Revenant Tom McCarthy, Spotlight Ridley Scott, The Martian George Miller, Mad Max:Fury Road
